title: Rugby World Cup: Scotland obliterates Romania 84-0 to set up Ireland showdown
description: Top-ranked Ireland leads Pool B but it could possibly fail to reach the quarterfinals if it loses to Scotland next Saturday at Stade de France.

title: Switzerland's annual battle with rising health insurance costs
description: In a country with no social security, citizens by law must purchase private health insurance, whose yearly costs have surged to the extent that one-third of households now rely on state aid to afford it.

title: Rugby World Cup: Fiji edges Georgia to keep quarter-finals in sight
description: Despite another nerve-stretching finish, the Fijians kept flying against Georgia on Saturday in Bordeaux. They survived trailing by nine points at halftime and a frantic final Georgian assault to win 17-12.

title: Boycott COP28: 'Holding a climate conference in Dubai is absurd and dangerous'
description: In a group letter published in 'Le Monde,' 180 climate advocates argue that carbon energy lobbyists have exerted undue influence over COP conferences, urging governments to overhaul the conference model and place it under UN protection.

title: Maldives: Pro-China candidate Mohamed Muizzu wins presidential election
description: The election has turned into a virtual referendum on which regional power – India or China – will have the biggest influence in the Indian Ocean archipelago nation.

title: Last-minute deal temporarily averts US government shutdown
description: On the brink of a federal government shutdown, the House of Representatives on Saturday swiftly approved a 45-day funding bill to keep federal agencies open. The deal includes a temporary freeze on aid to Ukraine.

title: The Gilberto legend: Bossa nova was born out of this family of bohemian brilliance
description: Never before has a musical style been so closely associated with a single surname. In the late 1950s, the Brazilian musician João Gilberto invented bossa nova. Its worldwide influence was as much the work of the guitarist as of his wives: Astrud, the unforgettable voice behind the hit 'The Girl From Ipanema,' and Miúcha, the queen of the genre. Miúcha's daughter, Bebel Gilberto, has now released 'João,' a tribute album to her father, who died in 2019.

title: Rugby World Cup: Argentina clings on to qualifying hope after victory over Chile
description: Los Pumas comfortably beat Chile to keep their dream of qualifying for quarter-finals alive. They now stand second in Pool D after England, but Japan remains a major challenger.

title: French arms manufacturers seek to establish a status in Ukraine
description: During a visit to Kyiv,  French Minister of the Armed Forces Sébastien Lecornu advocated for business partnerships with the Ukrainians.

title: Sweden calls in the army in as gang warfare escalates
description: Conflicts between rival gangs left 12 people dead in the Nordic country in September alone. The gangs, which have branches abroad, are recruiting younger and younger children.

title: How do you talk to your children about pedophilia?
description: Parents struggle to find the right words to talk about sexual violence

title: Trench warfare makes a comeback in Ukraine's fight against Russia
description: In an attempt to break through Russian lines, Kyiv’s forces are abandoning armored vehicles, which are considered ineffective, in favor of close-quarters infantry combat, almost hand-to-hand.

title: Nagorno-Karabakh: A tragic but predictable outcome
description: The Baku coup, which led to the exodus of the Armenian population, is a reflection of the geopolitical context in which force increasingly prevails over law.

title: Slovakia goes to the pools to choose between pro-Russia former PM and liberal pro-West newcomer
description: Slovaks voted on September 30 in a tight early election seen as key to whether the country will keep supporting neighbouring Ukraine after a campaign marked by disinformation.

title: Rugby World Cup: Dupont returns to French squad after surgery
description: The French team captain got the green light to progressively rejoin training and is expected to be fit to play in the quarter-finals.

title: New York paralyzed as torrential flash flooding overwhelms city's infrastructure
description: Fifteen centimeters of rain fell on Manhattan on Friday, inundating the city's evacuation capacities and bringing most transportation to a standstill. Mayor Eric Adams was attacked for his lack of foresight.

title: 'Less red meat and more chicken strips.' How soaring inflation alters French consumers' habits
description: Faced with rising food prices, customers have no choice but to load less into their shopping carts, downgrade their purchased products and cut back on other expenses.

title: How China became an electric car giant
description: Since 2009, Beijing has provided both direct subsidies and indirect assistance to boost emerging Chinese electric vehicle companies. In response, Brussels has initiated an investigation, a move applauded by European manufacturers.

title: Let's not abandon Nagorno-Karabakh on the altar of 'unspeakable cynicism'
description: Marie Toussaint, a Green Party (EELV) member of the European Parliament, and Simon Abkarian, actor and director, question if Europe is willing to ignore ethnic cleansing for gas supplies as Azerbaijan takes control of the separatist Armenian enclave.

title: Paris Fashion Week: A sense of celebration
description: Roses by the thousands at Balmain, silver harem pants at Rabanne, sequined denim with a disco touch at Acne Studios – all showcasing designers embracing vibrant and whimsical fashion.

title: A fragmented ballet season begins at the Opéra de Paris
description: The rerun of Crystal Pite's 'The Seasons' Canon' retains all its spellbinding power, but the works by Marion Motin and Xie Xin are unconvincing.

title: AI's dizzying capability to dub one voice into a foreign language
description: Tools from the startup HeyGen and the Internet giant Google use artificial intelligence to translate videos by cloning and synchronizing the speaker's voice.

title: Tech giants race to unleash conversational AI assistants
description: Recent announcements from Meta, Google, Microsoft, and Amazon highlight their investment in AI to usher in a new generation of virtual assistants, but questions are being raised regarding the practicality and ethical implications of these new services.
